tasks: Thermodynamics of multi-colored loop models in three dimensions
results: Symmetric loops undergo a first order phase transition, while non-symmetric loops show a second order transition
Specific heat exponent for non-symmetric loops is different from XY model
Inter-color interactions alter the nature of the phase transition from continuous to discontinuous
title: Thermodynamics of Multi-Colored Loop Models in Three Dimensions.pdf
abstract: We show that the nature of the transition is intimately related to the nature of the loops. The symmetric loops undergo a first order phase transition, while the non-symmetric loops show a second-order transi- tion. The critical exponents for the non-symmetric loops are calculated. In three dimensions, the regular loop model with no interactions is dual to the XY model. We argue that, due to interactions among the colors, the specific heat exponent is found to be different from that of the regular loop model. The continuous nature of the transition is altered to a discontinuous one due to the strong inter-color interactions. I.
